Vilify: Two years. That's how long I've been searching for you. How long it's been since you took away everything that was important to me and made me see the world for how it is. In a sick way... I really should thank you. Because with out you... with out you ruining everything I had... I wouldn't even be here. I wouldn't be here, as a hunter: Hunting for the truth, those who are hellbent on causing chaos to this world, and faithful allies to help me as I go. Most importantly, I will find you and take you out like the monster you are...finally having my revenge. Sweet, sweet revenge. You can't vilify this simple truth, my old friend.
Villageguard: Somewhere in medieval England, in a small village, a new class of Village Guards are chosen. For the next twelve months their job is to protect the health and well-being of the other villagers. It's a tough job, it's a dangerous job, but this being a manga, pre-teen girls are recruited for the job. You are now magically transported to this village where your life will depend on a small band of lolis who try their very best to protect and serve... their very best isn't really very good, though.
VillainUprising: An urban teenager named Jeremy loses the luxury of gaming, watching movies, dicking around the internet, chronically masturbating, consuming artery-clogging junk food, and bullshitting his way through school the night before attending a local gaming convention when he suffers a heart attack in his sleep. Next door to his hotel room, a young, androgynous escort nearly drowns at the hands of an unstable client. After a female participant fends off the attacker and resuscitates the boy, Jeremy's soul inhabits the body in a moment of confusion. In a struggle to come to terms with the life he lost and the new one he gained, Jeremy dumps old habits and becomes determined to live like a villain to the status quo in an effort to pay homage to the original owner of his body.
Vindibudd: The Adventures of Vindibudd Superhero In Training is a comic strip about Vindibudd and his sidekick General Safety. They are both aspiring superheroes who nominally attend an International Academy of Superhero Sciences. For the most part, Vindibudd is concerned with righting wrongs that he perceives and most of the wrongs he perceives are perpetrated against him. General Safety just does it for the puppies. Other characters are Vindibabe, Vindibudd's girlfriend and Common Sense Girl, a superhero instructor and enforcer. Villains include Not Vindibudd, an alternate dimension Vindibudd who is really hung up on the name Vindibudd and also Miss Illogical and Major Reckless.
ViolentTendencies: Based off of bits n' pieces of my life, plus random brain spewings, Violent Tendencies' characters are mostly the people I am surrounded by every day. There is no clear story line, only attempts at humor and venting my frustration. Read, and enjoy it.
Violentblue: A retrogamer, A comic fan, a punk Grrrl and a mean squirrel deal with life, pop culture, God and each other.
Violetandskwid: Violet is a detective. She's assisted by Skwid, a strange squid-like creature who breathes air, not water. They're an odd pair, but with Violet's brains and Skwid's intuition, they never leave a case unsolved.
Viperandcompany: A humanoid snake stay with a couple of anthros who also once humans. So they must try to find the way to turn themselves into humans again with a help of two non-anthro critters and two humans, a 22 year old girl and a 43 year old smoker.
Viraltrsr: This is the worst virus story,anybody would ever know of. Instead of running out,we are running into the infected area.After the first few pages,if u think story is predictable,then yes! I WILL Challenge evertbody from DAN BROWN to J.K.Rowling that they're also predictable. The start is lousy,but I tell you to read it all and then tell me.
Virtualiron: Dumb stuff that happens in video games.
VisualDiary: Two sides to an aspiring artist. Multiple personality disorder? Perhaps. Laughs? Definitely. "The Early Years" part of the comic that updates on Wednesday will more story based than the gags on the normal updates. Updates: Mon, Tues, Thurs, Fri - regular randomness Wednesday - "Early Years" Saturday - Art day
Vksb: An awesome castle, mouse servants to do his bidding, and immortality; what more could an undead feline want? Someone to share his adventures with! Join Vampire Kitty as he ventures out into the great unknown in search of friendship, adventure, and feats of derring-do!
VocalFrenzy: Kaia wants to start a pop band. Her brother refuses to join her, even after she had heard him singing in the shower with an amazing voice. However, Kaia's determination leads her to starting her own small pop band called Vocal Frenzy. Now, it's off to a battle of the bands, along with dramas and other sorts and maybe even possibly meeting her all time idol, Nova. Of course, being a growing pop star isn't easy. It has it's ups and downs and a whole lot of drama.
Voco: 5000 years ago, the world was shaken by the harrowing legend of blood. Deep hatred tore blood lines apart, forcing the world into a neverending war between good and evil. One man struggles to fight against the evil of the world while his power itself may one day corrupt and consume his soul. This is a story how a man hunts for the evil that destroyed him. Will it be a fight for justice or will it be a fight for vengeance? [WARNING: May contain violence, strong language, nudity, sexual content and/or blood and gore]
Vodcomic: A Pokemon Sprite Comic Featuring Leonardo Hansen a boy of 16 who wants to travel the great region of Kanto, unlocking mysteries hidden for everyone, even for him...
Voelkermord: An individual without a home, say, a vagabond of sorts is lost in a world filled with cut-throat lunatics. Will he ever find a way to peace, freedom, justice,love, glory, triumph, etc. etc.???
Volume8Bit: Random funnies in the life of a nerd.
Vortaflex: When mad people interact...mad things happen. Things might even get violent. But in the cozy asylum of Vortaflex, things got brilliant. At least they did. But now, things are not what they seem anymore.
VotR: In a world that sees no sun due to a strange storm that struck 14 years ago, and the human population turned into animalistic form known as "substati" due to an unknown disease-like cause, Jeina Minshall, a homeless cat boy taken in by a poet, Laston Aguire, is dragged into a war of secrets stemming from his unusually kind caretaker. A mystery unfolds as story of many faces begins with the verses of the rain.
Voxpopuli: An superhero comic set in a dystopian future where a revolution is slowly gaining ground.
Voyagercomics: "Voyager Comics" exists to tell various stories created by Chris Van Dyke and Benjamin Blattberg. We're mostly interested in playing around with genres, so you can expect mostly science fiction, fantasy, Lovecraftian horror, et cetera, all with a bit of a twist. Starting in the Fall there will be a long-term major story with occasional shorter stories between chapters.
Voyans: It's a web comic, about nothing...
VulgarIssues: Welcome to the life of Ry. A 17 year old witch with a fucked up past. Follow him as he lives his life in and out of insanity, he soon learns that there's more to being a witch than he thought. Now he must begin a journey to find himself. Entering and exiting the world of insanity is his only hope in understanding the purpose of witchcraft in this world.
Vvardenfell: A comedic adventure in the world of Morrowind.
Vystrizeno: Zcela fiktivní příběhy na základě skutečných událostí...
WG: Über Tiere und Menschen, über Künstler und Arbeiter, über Liebe und Hass, getarnt als lustige Webcomicserie.
WLiSB: Laugh at the not-so-epic quest of a group of teenagers trying to play a game of Dungeons and Dragons. Art style inspired by Rich Burlew's Order of the Stick.
WLifeComic: A webcomic following the adventures of Jovenski, a Night Elf Hunter, and Llivia, a Draenei Priest.
WMNGU: A comic about a young hero, or rather a lame Pokémon trainer who's often mistaken for being a girl named Oliver Jedan, on his new adventure together with his Oshawott. Together, they have to fight Gym Leaders and even the Elite four, and even have to go against a childhood friend who joins forces with the bad guys. Get ready for a whole new adventure through an unknown region in the Pokémon Universe!
WMR: Llewelyn Connor discovered, at a young age, that He is destined to walk a Heroes path to greatness. However, once he comes to an age to actually do something about it, life decides to play some games with him, When a girl from his past returns with...
WSOGMM: A place where I can periodically add individual short comics and links to my other projects.
WTBC: Will fill in later... just testing for now.
WTC: Mordecai and Farley are two police officers in the town called Cornville where animals and humans live together as regular folk. Mordecai, Farley and the other boys at the police station haven't been given a case for almost a whole week. The boys are really on the edge. Finally, Mordecai and Farley get given a case---on a rabbit?! Righto then. This is sort of a mystery comedy comic.
WTNJackAmatti: An Original Character Tournament on DeviantArt I intended to enter. Life got in the way and I had to back out, unfortunately. The first few pages of it remain here, if you're interested.
WYIHN: A young Christian boy named Matthew runs into a delinquent on his way to school one day, after a bad first impression he runs into this boy once again, and contemplates pressing charges. But being a good boy Matthew believing that everyone should get a second chance, so instead he tries to make a deal, if the delinquent decides to participate in all his religious duties with him and converts to Christianity he won't call the cops on the poor soul. Of course people are more complicated than we sometimes assume, and things don't always go as planned, or so Matthew discovers.
WabbitConcept: An original dramedy series on animals and humans that features an extensive cast that all seem to be on adventures or casual activities, like gaming. It's based in a futuristic parallel universe.
Wagashinobi: Jun runs away from her life as a shinobi and tries to start over. She wants to live a life that is bubbly and shoujo-esque, like in the mangas. However, when she follows her dreams about being a wagashi-artisan, it turns out her training grounds are almost (if not just) as violent as her previous life's. She's heard of "high school", but the one she landed in brings out the fighter in her. Can she ever live as a normal citizen in modern society? Also how will she be able to live a simple life with also her past catching up to her?
Waitwhat: What is this, I don't even
WakeUp: Sam, Chester and Max have been pulled out of their dream by malevolent spirits obsessed by power and conflict. Sam Chester and Max are trapped within the Dream world with only their knowledge of gaming to defend themselves and survive until they can find a way to wake up.
Wakethesleepers: An ancient, deadly curse has inflicted Locke Rinannis. He now must race against time as he struggles to find a cure before his life is consumed by it. Along the way, he makes allies, confronts powerful enemies, and unearths the mystery of a lore long forgotten... (Updates every Friday)
WakingNightmare: We all feel down sometimes. Most people deal via help from people they love. Unfortunately, I'm a lonely, hateful gremlin of a man. The internet is the teat from which I eagerly suckle, and this comic is the warm, blood-tinged mental ejaculate with which I earnestly attempt to repay her for her kindness.
Walk: Post Apocalyptic Stories, Straight to your heart.
Walkingbehindslowpeople: Miss Candyholic adventures through the city.
WallShanna66: Wall is a small, quiet town in the english countryside. Nothing too unusual about it other than the gate to Hell on the edge of the town. The story mainly follows a young woman by the name of Alice who lived ther as a child until her house was burned down and her parents killed. Years later her therapist tells her it would be good for her mental health to return to Wall to confront her nightmares. Updates will happen when they happen. I have no set schedule for this comic so dont get mad if it goes a while without updates.
Wallagags: Wallachia's not-at-all expected return with his brand new webomics: Wallagags. Because making sense is too mainstream.
Walrusfandango: Let the shameless plot development begin!
Wander: Wander is an experimental four panel comic. I have a few old pages already made, and after that random updates are potentially possible.
Wanderers: Updated every monday! In The Red Sands, the ruined remnants of a devastated world, two sides are at war. The Royal Army, which seeks to dominate the wasteland. And The Remnant Militia, who fight against them. And in the middle of it all are two Wanderers, desperate to keep alive in the midst of a chaotic world.
Wandererscomic: Short excerpts from the lives of two post-apocalyptic wanderers, both possessed of a wide array of mental disorders.
Wangfork: The story of Wangfork, a strange creature people call 'Bulb Head'. The closest to his kind that scientists can identify is an angler fish because of his bright bulb on his head. He lives underground. In the dark. But not for long...
WarOfTheOmniEmerald: A continuation of an old story I've done. Which sucks, because the old one was horrible and no one will ever see it.. But, at least you get to know the ending! :P
Warden: The adventures of Warden J.H. Cale as he keeps order in the Solarian Empire.
Warhamsters: An epic struggle to survive in a hostile post-apocalyptic wasteland beset with dangers. Oh, and it's about hamsters.
Warpedwonderland: The great kingdom of Warped Wonderland, a desolate place filled to the brim with strange creatures many of which would snap your neck or devour your soul without a second thought. Those who are brave enough, stupid enough or those who have no choice live here under the rule of Prince Posy. Now Posy isn't too nice a fellow and his tyrannical rule has made some of the locals rather upset so pridictable a rebellion has started to form. This comic follows a particular group of rebels led by the rebel leader, Kai, in thier journeys to take back the throne. All rights reserved for the Warped Wonderland Roleplayers.
Warringatplay: We've all seen Toy Story. The idea that your toys move around when you're not there. But what if they did more than that? What if your toys were locked in a brutal civil war? And what if the ultimaate prize... was control of YOU?
Warrioranorphan: A rash decision turns into an awkward situation for warrior Bane. A challenge he doesn't want to accept or deal with. Sadly he has no choice, and it will bring upon him some interesting challenges. Maybe even soften him up.
WarriorcatsTNP: Darkness, air, water, and sky will come together... and shake the forest to its roots. Wariors: The New Prophecy is now in fan-comic form! Follow the journey of Brambleclaw, Squirrelpaw, Stormfur, Feathertail, Tawneypelt, and Crowpaw in their quest to fulfill StarClan's prophecy. Best read after Erin Hunter's original Warrior Cats series for best understanding of the world.
Warsane: This comic shows you how the Great War III started. Old rivals, the US and the Germans, have been led to a major war by horribly hated Hitler. He tried to invade the US again, and he decided to have a great war with US where Roosevelt was waiting for him.
Wasabicoffee: Welcome to Jojo and Connar. Connar is stuck making coffee, whilst trying to find anything else to do with life. Jojo is just Jojo...
Wastedspace: Randy and Vincent start a local band with delusions of grandeur. Read along as they scout for members, write songs, and play gigs. Will they make it to the big leagues?
Wasteland: Between the bullets and the blue sky, forever lies a thousand acre wasteland.
Wastesofspace: This is a cartoony sci-fi comic starring a cast of odd alien types. My art style is inspired by Ninja Turtles and MegaMan. Visit the hub at mysticfetus.com! Oh, and hey! Don't forget to subscribe if you're a comicfury member!
Wat: What exactly is wat? What does it mean? Webcomic Awesome Tits? Webcomics Are Tubular? Not even the creator knows! But now YOU TOO can marvel at this AMAZING and (sort-of) funny masterpiece! WARNING! This is NSFW (sometimes)!
Watchfornecromancers: Welcome to a neighborhood of necromancers, man-whores, and a lot of late-night goings on that are not really worth the mention.
Watchingmoviesatwork: We work at a library, and it's very uneventful, so we made a list of movies to watch at work.
Wateroneshot: Do you believe in happy endings? Zoey and Kari love each other, and nothing can go wrong. But oh, something does. Again and again...
Wayofthemetagamer: Bob buys the Dungeons and Dragons book off eBay. Hilarity ensues. Plot follows. Also tropes. Lots and lots of tropes. Also no fourth wall. Actually, it's mostly about the lack of fourth wall. We probably should have mentioned that bit right at the top. Actually, yeah, move that to the top- you're writing this LIVE?
Wbp: I am not a comicmancer! I simply put down my crude drawings in front of you and walk away. These drawings usually turn out to not be funny to me after a week or so, but that's why the comic is titled "wait before posting".
Wbt: Just like any other CYOA, except I have zero control.
WeAreAllGiants: There are going to be times when you feel like giving up. There will be times when your shoulders hurt from the weight you are forced to put on them, and there will be times when everything you want is just far enough away. When these dark clouds pass overhead, this is when you must realize that you can stand up, and in standing up, see that you now tower over the sky itself. Your eyes reach past the clouds and all you need is now fully within your reach. You and me? We are all giants.
Weakness: This fancomic is based in the Videogame: Legacy of Kain. Kain has awaked his six sons, but they were humans before, so they have not evolved yet....How could be that process? I made my own interpretation of characters to adapt them to manga version. Due my native language is not English, i want to apologize for mistakes and i will be more than happy if you help me with corrections! I want to improve my English!! ^^
Weareacheapgroupofpenguins: It's just a regular, average day in the town of Flamville...UNFORTUNATELY, best friends Rob and Larry cause as much mayhem in Flamville as possible. With the attention span of a retarded walrus, the duo face this mayhem as if it were as normal as dipping pickles in a jar of powdered cheese(and that's important!).
Weatherornot: arning: weather personified, what really is going on up there? Come see who does what and their interactions (may be due to rapid change) The clouds hold a cluster of mystery along with holding a secret world of the sky people, the true creators weather. Cloudy is a confused rebellious teenager with an uncertain destiny when he finally comes face to face with the Windy, the one would destroys his artwork in the skies and discovers a great evil coming into the skies. A wacky weatherman tries to find out what really is going between pressure and temperature above the clouds Remember Lighting flashes twice! contains: comedy, weather, rain clouds, fog, thunder lighting, day , night, climate, silliness, logic, enlightenment, sexy situations, yuri, yaoi, hetero pairings
Webcomicofdoom: Superhero parody comic in the vein of classic MAD and CRACKED magazines.
Weblightdreams: Imagine if what you thought about dreams turned out to be wrong. What if dreams were more then just projections of one's thoughts and worries. What if dreams were glimpses of other universes that our unconciousness picked up while we slept. Enter into the word known as Weblight Dreams, where the dreaming never stops.
WeboftheEponymousBook: An enigma of a tome of enigmas. Woven into the story's tangled web are numerous puzzles whose solutions provide keys to unlocking information that changes the reader's understanding of the story. The solutions themselves are merely clues to greater, more complex and more encompassing puzzles, not the least of which is the untangling of the WEB itself.
WednesdayChaos: Got me some bitter shit, got me some angry shit; most of all, got me some shit at all. That's all a southern girl needs, right?
Weeaboo: A comic. With Videogame characters. NOBODY ELSE HAS THOUGHT OF THIS.
Weedaholicbeverages: Do you have highdeas that you want everyone share in? Yeah me too, I make comics about them.
Weeds: Cyde Holiday is not your typical 20-year-old. He's grumpy, secluded, rude and possessive. His only friend, Beau Lazaro, is having touble with Cyde and his rudeness when he tries to get a job in a flower shop with one of Cyde's old classmates whom Cyde doesn't trust.
Weft: Several stories about several individuals who may not be so individual.
Weglowinthedark: A comic about random crap and my life
Wehazacookie: The insanity of Kitt and Shirik's life - some based on real events, most based on randomness. Updates Saturdays!
Weirdguy: Undescribable adventures of a guy with weird powers!
Weirdinghour: Really? right hear? why why I dunno what to say!
Weirdladyslife: Weird Lady means well, but she's a little peculiar. These are her thoughts and wishes.
Weirdville: This comic is about a family of aliens who live on a planet with pet dog and a robot friend.
Weirdwest: A meditation on weirdness in the old west.
Weisser: Welcome to Weisser University! These are the misadventures of some of its students.
WelcomeBackZombie: It has been 35 years since the Zombie Apocalypse destroyed all of humanity. Now with nothing left to do the zombies of the world must adjust to normal life.
Welcometohell: Rozana Valencia is dead. She is not too happy about being sent to Hell, however, Hell is not really what she imagined it to be.
Welcometostupid: This is where brain cells come to die without the aid of narcotics or alcohol. These comics reflect on the inner stupidity of someone considered smart by the people around him.
WelcomingFriday: The day in the life of Alex and a couple of his closest friends as they go on adventures of real life (work, school ect), games, comics and love...
Wellington: Welcome to The Very British Adventures of Wellington and Co.! We are a gag-a-day webcomic that updates whenever we want, mostly because we're lazy and tend to forget about such trivial matters. As such, The Very British Adventures of Wellington and Co. is a humorous webcomic that shows the going ons in a certain British petunia shop, and its overly sensitive owner. The most we would rate this comic is PG-13 for language, mostly because yes, we're teenagers, and yes, we tend to have something slip out once and a while that isn't exactly kid friendly. However, there will be no romance, erotica or anything else... seriously, that stuff isn't very fun to see. We do not intend to insult, deprecate, or otherwise offend anyone of any race or color. We are well aware that our characters do not represent a country as a whole, and our jokes are only meant to poke a little fun at others broad stereotypes. So please, don't come to us with a stick up your arse complaining that we are insulting another country. If you're going to be offended, I suggest you don't read it. So follow Wellington, Seamus, Reja and Kayo-ssi as they embark on an epic journey to survive the horrors of everyday life in Britain, and also running a petunia shop!
Wellthatsjustsuper: An over enthusiastic group of super hero parodies, lead by the infamous cat man are the only thing that stand between Blockham city (excuse the pun)and the villainous scum that lurks in the shadows. so basically their doomed.
Wemustbepsycho: Sometimes, truth really is stranger than fiction--and this group of friends knows it better than anyone. Join the Du Jour (or is it Gingiva?) gang as they navigate their way through their last years of high school, smooth times and rocky times, a jam-packed summer vacation, and finally--college. But be warned--there will be corny jokes. There will be mispronunciations of words. There will be inflatable whales. And there will always be Too Much Information.
Werewolf: Webcomic exclusively devoted to the forum game of [url=http://comicfury.com/forum/viewthread.php?id=2797]Werewolf[/url], and all sequels thereof. When the wolves attack, it's a bleak day...when neighbor turns against neighbor, who's safe? Nobody. Anything goes, Hilarity Ensues, and you never quite know what's going to happen next...
Werewolfthegame: The village of Comicfury'sville is stricken by a case of lycanthropy. Will the villagers be able to survive by haphazardly lynching one person per day until all of the wolves are gone? This comic follows the game Werewolf on the ComicFury forums, starting from [url=http://comicfury.com/forum/viewthread.php?id=3509]Game VII[/url] and onward. It primarily uses the images already present in the game threads, created by the hosts of each game.
Weshippo: Wes is an orange hippo who is skilled at building gadgets to help him face challenges in a Cuh-razy world! But not that crazy. Suppose to update Tuesdays at 6pm.
Westbound: A slice of life as seen through the eyes of Jake, yer typical awkward artist with lessons to be earned all the time.
Westernawesome: Time stopped years ago, nobody has any idea of the time or date. An unlikely bunch of individuals embark on an adventure each with they're own goals and ambitions.
Westofnowhere: A sci-fi/western romp starring a cast of skewed cliches. You'll laugh. You'll cry. You'll say, "Wasn't that an episode of 'Little House on the Prairie?'" and then your Pa will hug you and call you 'Half-Pint,' and you'll realize that you must have been mistaken.
Westsrangers: The story of West and his Rangers.
Westuthehedgehog: A story about Sonic's brother, Westu, as he tries to stop the world from evil.
Wetware13: In the near-future, the consciousness of a young woman becomes curiously trapped inside the mainframe of a enormous software company that specializes in interactive video gaming experiences. To return to the real world, she must navigate the bizarre tropes and worlds of video games, assembling her shattered link code to rejoin her body - and continually forced to confront the mainframes security measures. A little bit of The Matrix, a little bit of Tron, but hopefully with a bit more sense and a serious injection of humor. A product of TedChristensenGallery.com
Wfa: There are no words to describe what you are about to see... except for the ones below: In 2004, three teens created what is undoubtedly the greatest film of all time. But then six years passed. And nothing else happened. Watching From Afar is about realizing that things don't quite work out the way you think they will but still having the courage to continue along anyways.
Wftb: A user driven comic! I'll post options on the comic, that YOU- yes you- can chose from! I'll tally up the results and the most popular option is done next week.
WhatIsThis: A journal comic expanded through the ideas, thoughts, and conversations of others. Probably weird, hopefully fun;
Whateveracademy: Welcome to Whatever Academy a college for those who aspire to be well...anything. From heroes to hermit crabs, if you want to major in it this school is for you; we even accept applications for psychology majors!
Whatif: This is a comic I did years ago. It is not my first comic but one of my favorites. I am in the process of painting these digitally right now. The plan is to release one page a week. This comic is based off of Marvel's Uncanny Xmen #251-253... but the story is changed. For those that have not read these issues I will give you a brief synopsis. Wolverine get's back to the X-Men's headquarters in Australia and he is basically ambushed by the cyborg super villain group called the Reavers. I didn't like Wolvie getting his butt kicked so I had to rewrite history. :) Wolverine, the X-Men, the Reavers, the Watcher, and all other characters in this book that I might have missed are property of Marvel Comics Group.
Whatintheworld: A zainy comic that ussualy makes no sense what so ever.
Whatmaylie: In the land of Kaizo, the population is humans,  everything else. All kinds of fairy tale creatures and monsters mingle together in the four different regions. However, unbeknownst to everyone, Kaizo contains more than just diversity. The land is home to all kinds of dark secrets that will affect everyone, and may even spell out doom for all the species. Discovering this, the half-dragon Ru attempts to discover just why Kaizo was created, and just what is the threat looming above everyone. However, her investigations just may be halted by the arrival of her deceased old friend's young son, the elf Lius.
Whatsinaloveletter: In the form of my piglet self, I'll tell you the story of what I thought was my first "crush". It is short and funny (or at least I'd like to think so.) Please enjoy.
Whatthefhtagn: When the Great Old Ones are released from their imprisonment on Earth, it turns out they are not quite the threat that they seemed. Now forced to roam the planet in their half powerful forms, they have no choice but to wait around before something supplies them to their full potential.
Whattheheck: A silly web comic about what the devil does in his spare time.
Whattimeitis: A awesome story's about two cool adventurers name Finn and Jake and theirs friends along the way.with a new princess. FROM THE SHOW THAT AIRS ON CARTOON NETWORK. I BRING YOU THE WEBCOMIC OF THAT.
Whatweremember: After four years apart, a group of old college friends reunite and meet new people as they live their lives out in the real world. Updates monday through friday
Whendaylightdies: When a 13 year old girl attempts suicide for the second time and fails, her parents send her to a mental institution in an attempt to "fix" her, while having as little to do with her as possible. As a coping mechanism, she imagines up a gigantic masked creature to avoid the real world.
Whenfoxesfly: Starting back in 2005 (with a different host), "When Foxes Fly" is an anthro spoof of superheroes and villains. One could classify it as a Christian comic, but others might say it would more accurately be described as a webcomic presented from a Christian perspective. In any event, it follows the adventures of Filbert (a flying fox) and Rusty as they discover that childlike Faith in Eternal Truth is more powerful than any superhero or villain.
Wheniwasalittleblackgirl: The terrible ravings of my future, senile self. He will learn you what's what!
Whensdays: I'm a guy with many interests- I act, I draw, I animate, I write, I film, I eat, I sleep. Lather, rinse and repeat. I'm also a guy with lots of ideas and not so much time to make them all happen. thus, the name "When's day comics"-- as in, "when's the next comic day gonna be?" well, it'll be a Wednesday, whenever I get a chance to get a new page done. It'd be easy to do one strip a week, but this is 4 or 5 on every page, and I still have to work the day job for now. I'm also working on getting a job animating. while that miracle is waiting to happen, I'm working on an animated short cartoon of my own. perhaps from time to time I'll insert a tease for it in the middle of the whensday comics continuity, just to whet folks' appetites. and as i get some scenes done (it's only a 3-minute short, with about 34 shots in it) I may share video links to completed bits. When it's all complete you can be sure that I'll be sharing the whole thing here! so stay tuned!
WhereMyGlaciersAt: or the adventures of staying cool during the hottest day in summer
Whereaboutshereabouts: Shenanigans in a garage. In suburbia. In Canada.
Wheresorrowsreach: `Where sorrows reach' is a short comic about the last moments of a girl as she is ferried across the Styx. Well aware of her destination she tells her story, not for redemption or compassion but to remove the sorrows from her heart and thus to be able to face her fate.
WheretheFMI: The Idea: Each Week the script for next week's issue will be made available. Artists will submit their version of next weeks issue based on that script. Then I will select a winner and display that image as the new issue. Notable runners up will be posted in a subpage similar to a fanart page. The Story: A young man in his work Uniform wakes up in a strange place full of doors. Each door leads into a bizarre world. Will he find his way home? Will he go mad? Yinyang: Dark and light, heaven and hell, good and bad, sun and moon...Yin and Yang. Life and death are not opposites, the Angel and the Devil not enemies. They are twins. This is a massive combination of all kinds of angel/devil, chinese, biblical, greek and celtic myths. Yin and Yang are pseudo 'God' and 'Satan', but the whole good and evil thing becomes blurry between them. Yin - Yin is basically 'God' or whatever positive force there is in the universe. Yin is both Earth and Water, the healing elements. His personification is how (in literal translation) God is described in the Judeo-Christian bible. There are a lot of things I have to back this up with, so dare I say, hes kind of an obnoxious, semi-narcissistic yuppie type guy who WILL (without shame) share his poetry with the rest of the world and loves that people listen with such intensity. He is god, isn't he? But however self obsessed, he's very caring and loving. Yin carries all the signs of water and earth both elementally and astrologically. Yang - Yang is considered the Devil, Satan or darker forces. Unfortunately, he's somewhat misunderstood. Because he's the opposite of God, this does NOT by any means mean he's evil. He's just very ambitious, as he's the carrier or wind and fire, the two elements associated with destruction. He's easily carried away and gets caught up with himself. No, he does not enjoy watching a human being whipped to death. Well, not necessarily. Let's just say his sense of right and wrong are a little hazy sometimes. Yin and Yang are not opposites, infact, far from it. They're very similar. Both as old as earth themselves, neither extremely compassionate towards humans (More of playthings, yes?) and both somewhat self absorbed. So in the beginning...well it was all pretty hazy.

YoCuz: Slice of life story about two best friends trying to make it out in the real world. THey're not like...kissing or anything. they're both straight. Totally straight. Just tight bros together, like they're close, but not physically.
YoiYoi: It's about a sixteen year old Youki (is explained in comic) who moved in with a 'master'. He tries to get used to his new life. This comic is set on another planet. PS: If you're wondering about the 'mistake' in the comic name...it's not a mistake... Youkis change their name once they finish 'school'.
Yolt: Wherein many random events and fourth-wall shattering episodes are subjected to alternate reality thespians, continuity constables, and ardent media types - all of which is presented in LegoVision.
Yoshitheatre: Mini comics related to the Superstar Saga fancomic My Immortal Fool that are not part of the main storyline. General Mario stuff may be put here, too.
Yosuke: Yosuke is a comic about a gun-for-hire and his team being hired by a man only known as Suit to do several tasks for him.
Youguestit: yah, it's just to keep track of the guest comics i make, or is it? i am not sure myself... updates once in a blue moon may update as often as once a week, to as seldom as when ever an author feels like it. if you want to make a guest comic, want a comic made for you, or want to be a guest, email Steve/Kenth at youguestit@gmail.com. if you want to know specifics about the choices, still email Steve/Kenth, cause after all, this is a guest web comic. just don't spam Steve/Kenth, he won't like it. Young: A worldwide epidemic has ravaged most humans on the earth by being mas produced as a drug called Seven. Several people around the world have unique resistances to the disease, Young and his family being some of them. Young seeks his father, who is among the highest ranking officials of Seven Corp., before time runs out and he is consumed by Seven himself.
YoureMyLove: Ai is a girl whose still in-love with her ex-boyfriend, Takuto, and she wants to get back with him more than anything! But the only problem is that Takuto hates her, and he has found another girl to take Ai's place!Ai is too stuborn to give up on getting back with her first love, so her and her friend Riku (who is in-love with Ai himself!) have joined forces to get Takuto back!
Yugiohthecurse: You all know how Yugi and Yami saved the world time and time again.Why don't we mix that story up and replace it with Yugi and Yami trying to destroy the world while trying to save it. The God Cards have died and been possessed by a shadow beast named Yerna who wants control over the world for pleasure. In the how mess Is Yami, Yugi, and...Yamif.
Yuuto: Bored with life, the self-proclaimed epitome of masculinity, Yuuto-san, forms a group to change the world in a way to better suit his unique style.
ZA: In the world of the Zombie Apocalypse....WHO CARES?
ZeichenWG: In der Zeichen WG wohnen: XD-Productions, Julien Risuke, Lesemaus, Klausi und Claudius... alle zusammen wohnen in einer WG wo es manchmal ganz chaotisch ist... ^^
Zero: He's not like other superheros, he doesn't have cape on his neck, it's on his head! Also, he doesn't wear tights! He doesn't have a superhero suit! He has regular clothes! Like normal people!
Zimikoknights: Before the Angel, the princess of East started her journey with her companions, the royalty searched hard for a way to stop the demons before she was forced to endure such trials. Meet the Zimiko Knights. The three siblings that carry the well known and respected Zimiko family name, a name know by all as the best family of knighthood in this country and any other. Kara and Eymon, the oldest and youngest of the siblings, are the prime example of of what you would expect from someone carrying this lineage to be. Serious, hardworking, strong and dedicated to their positions in the royalty as well as their craft. Clor, the middle child of the three, does not exactly fit this ideal mold. Lazy, defiant, and often found flirting with beautiful ladies instead of practising his swordsmanship, he isn't exactly one you want carrying your families honourable name. As the saying goes you can't choose your family, and these three as well as the commanders of the four royalties, have been given the difficult task of ending the upcoming war before it has the chance to start…
Zionunderground: Once upon time, I worked at the front desk of a National Park Lodge, in Zion National Park in Utah. There, in the idle times, I doodled on the backs of leftover dining cards and left stacks of them lying around-- some were taken by guests, by other workers, or maybe even magic elves. Once drawn, I was done with them. Now, today, I find my girlfriend had kept copies of them for her own amusement and wanted me to publish them... so, here's some for YOU...
ZurvanClub: "A Place Lost in Time", is the first episode of the adventures of "The Zurvan Club", where a group of young people join their skills in order to solve a mystery written in an old Sumerian carving that will lead them to amazing discoveries about our past that could change our future. So, join to Alex, Julia and friends in their quest for the origins of Humankind and their great adventures in the most exotic and unexpected places.
Zwarnok: Leave immediately if you dislike the following: aliens, non-sequiturs, video games, internet humor, basement dwellers.
